## Schema.from() method

Creates a new Schema instance with type assertion to JsonSchema. This utility function breaks type inference chain to prevent TypeScript errors.

**Signature:**

```typescript
static from(schema: Schema | JsonSchema, parent?: Schema): Schema<JsonSchema>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

schema


</td><td>

[Schema](./json-schema.schema.md) \| [JsonSchema](./json-schema.jsonschema.md)


</td><td>

Source schema (Schema instance or JsonSchema object)


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

parent


</td><td>

[Schema](./json-schema.schema.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional parent Schema for inheritance


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[Schema](./json-schema.schema.md)<!-- -->&lt;[JsonSchema](./json-schema.jsonschema.md)<!-- -->&gt;

Schema instance with explicit JsonSchema type

## Example


```ts
const rawSchema = { type: "string", pattern: "^[A-Z]+$" };
const schema = Schema.from(rawSchema);
```
